name: Acute Scent
entries: When you {@action Rage}, your sense of smell improves. You gain imprecise {@ability scent} with a range of 30 feet.

name: Acute Vision
entries: When you are raging, your visual senses improve, granting you {@ability darkvision}.

name: Adapted Cantrip
entries: Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style. Choose one cantrip from a magical tradition other than your own. If you have a spell repertoire or a spellbook, replace one of the cantrips you know or have in your spellbook with the chosen spell. If you prepare spells without a spellbook (if you're a cleric or druid, for example), one of your cantrips must always be the chosen spell, and you prepare the rest normally. You can cast this cantrip as a spell of your class's tradition.
If you swap or retrain this cantrip later, you can choose its replacement from the same alternate tradition or a different one.

name: Adaptive Adept
entries: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition. Choose a cantrip or 1st-level spell from the same magical tradition as your cantrip from {@feat Adapted Cantrip}. You gain that spell, adding it to your spell repertoire, spellbook, or prepared spells just like the cantrip from {@feat Adapted Cantrip}. You can cast this spell as a spell of your class's magical tradition. If you choose a 1st-level spell, you don't gain access to the heightened versions of that spell, meaning you can't prepare them if you prepare spells and you can't learn them or select the spell as a signature spell if you have a spell repertoire.

name: Additional Lore
entries: Your knowledge has expanded to encompass a new field. Choose an additional {@skill Lore} skill subcategory. You become trained in it. At 3rd, 7th, and 15th levels, you gain an additional skill increase you can apply only to the chosen {@skill Lore} subcategory.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you must select a new subcategory of {@skill Lore} and you gain the additional skill increases to that subcategory for the listed levels.

name: Adopted Ancestry
entries: You're fully immersed in another ancestry's culture and traditions, whether born into them, earned through rite of passage, or bonded through a deep friendship or romance.

Choose a common ancestry. You can select ancestry feats from the ancestry you chose, in addition to your character's own ancestry, as long as the ancestry feats don't require any physiological feature that you lack, as determined by the GM.

name: Advanced Arcana
entries: You gain one {@filter wizard|feats||classes=wizard} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your wizard level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter wizard|feats||classes=wizard} feat.

name: Advanced Blood Potency
entries: You gain one {@filter sorcerer|feats||classes=sorcerer} feat. For the purpose of prerequisites, your sorcerer level is half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you do, you gain another {@filter sorcerer|feats||classes=sorcerer} feat.

name: Advanced Bloodline
entries: You have studied your bloodline to learn the secrets of its magic. You gain the advanced bloodline spell associated with your bloodline. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

name: Advanced Concoction
entries: You gain one {@filter alchemist|feats||classes=alchemist} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your alchemist level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter alchemist|feats||classes=alchemist} feat.

name: Advanced Deity's Domain
entries: Through your conviction, you have glimpsed the deeper secrets of your {@pf2etools deity|deities.html}'s domain. You gain an advanced domain spell from the domain you chose with {@feat Deity's Domain}. You can cast that spell as a devotion spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

name: Advanced Devotion
entries: You gain one {@filter champion|feats||classes=champion} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your champion level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter champion|feats||classes=champion} feat.

name: Advanced Dogma
entries: You gain one {@filter cleric|feats||classes=cleric} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your cleric level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter cleric|feats||classes=cleric} feat.

name: Advanced Domain
entries: Your studies or prayers have unlocked deeper secrets of your deity's domain. You gain an advanced domain spell from one.

name: Advanced Fury
entries: You gain one {@filter barbarian|feats||classes=barbarian} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your barbarian level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter barbarian|feats||classes=barbarian} feat.

name: Advanced Hunter's Trick
entries: You gain one {@filter ranger|feats||classes=ranger} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your ranger level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter ranger|feats||classes=ranger} feat.

name: Advanced Kata
entries: You gain one {@filter monk|feats||classes=monk} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your monk level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter monk|feats||classes=mon} feat.

name: Advanced Maneuver
entries: You gain a {@filter fighter|feats||classes=fighter} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your fighter level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter fighter|feats||classes=fighter} feat.

name: Advanced Muse's Whispers
entries: You gain one {@filter bard|feats||classes=bard} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your bard level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter bard|feats||classes=bard} feat.

name: Advanced School Spell
entries: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. If you're an {@class wizard|crb|abjurer|abjuration|crb}, you gain {@spell energy absorption}; if you're a {@class wizard|crb|conjurer|conjuration|crb}, you gain {@spell dimensional steps}; if you're a {@class wizard|crb|diviner|divination|crb}, you gain {@spell vigilant eye}; if you're an {@class wizard|crb|enchanter|enchantment|crb}, you gain {@spell dread aura}; if you're an {@class wizard|crb|evoker|evocation|crb}, you gain {@spell elemental tempest}; if you're an {@class wizard|crb|illusionist|illusion|crb}, you gain {@spell invisibility cloak}; if you're a {@class wizard|crb|necromancer|necromancy|crb}, you gain {@spell life siphon}; and if you're a {@class wizard|crb|transmuter|transmutation|crb}, you gain {@spell shifting form}. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

name: Advanced Trickery
entries: You gain one {@filter rogue|feats||classes=rogue} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your rogue level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter rogue|feats||classes=rogue} feat.

name: Advanced Weapon Training
entries: You've studied the art of wielding an advanced weapon.
Choose a weapon group. You gain proficiency with all advanced weapons in that group as if they were martial weapons of their weapon group.

name: Advanced Wilding
entries: You gain one {@filter druid|feats||classes=druid} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your druid level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter druid|feats||classes=druid} feat.

name: Advantageous Assault
entries: When an enemy's movement is compromised, you deliver a more deadly blow. Make a {@action Strike} against a creature that is {@condition grabbed}, {@condition prone}, or {@condition restrained}. You gain a circumstance bonus to damage on this {@action Strike} equal to the number of weapon damage dice, or that number + 2 if you're wielding the weapon in two hands. The {@action Strike} gains the following failure effect.

entries.Failure: You deal damage to the target equal to the number of weapon damage dice, or that number + 2 if you're wielding the weapon in two hands. This damage has the same damage type as the weapon.

name: Affliction Mercy
entries: The divine grace that flows through you grants reprieve from an affliction. When you use {@feat Mercy}, you can instead attempt to {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting} a {@trait curse}, {@trait disease}, or {@trait poison}.

name: Ageless Patience
entries: You work at a pace born from longevity that enhances your thoroughness. You can voluntarily spend twice as much time as normal on a {@skill Perception} check or skill check to gain a +2 circumstance bonus to that check. You also don't treat a natural 1 as worse than usual on these checks; you get a critical failure only if your result is 10 lower than the DC. For example, you could get these benefits if you spent 2 actions to {@action Seek}, which normally takes 1 action. You can get these benefits during exploration by taking twice as long exploring as normal, or in downtime by spending twice as much downtime.
The GM might determine a situation doesn't grant you a benefit if a delay would be directly counterproductive to your success, such as a tense negotiation with an impatient creature.

name: Aggressive Block
trigger: You use the {@feat Shield Block} reaction, and the opponent that triggered {@feat Shield Block} is adjacent to you and is your size or smaller.
entries: You push back as you block the attack, knocking your foe away or off balance. You use your shield to push the triggering creature, either automatically {@action Shove||Shoving} it 5 feet or causing it to become {@condition flat-footed} until the start of your next turn. The triggering creature chooses whether to be moved or become {@condition flat-footed}. If it chooses to be moved, you choose the direction. If the {@action Shove} would cause it to hit a solid object, enter a square of {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}, or enter another creature's space, it must become {@condition flat-footed} instead of being moved.

name: Agile Grace
entries: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare.
Your multiple attack penalty with {@trait agile} weapons and {@trait agile} unarmed attacks becomes –3 for your second attack and –6 for subsequent attacks (rather than –4 and –8).

name: Alchemical Crafting
entries: You can use the {@action Craft} activity to create alchemical items. When you select this feat, you immediately add the formulas for four common 1st-level alchemical items to your formula book.

name: Alchemical Familiar
entries: You have used alchemy to create life, a simple creature formed from alchemical materials, reagents, and a bit of your own blood. This alchemical familiar appears to be a small creature of flesh and blood, though it might have some unusual or distinguishing aspects depending on your creative process. Like other familiars, your alchemical familiar assists you in your laboratory and on adventures. The familiar uses your Intelligence modifier to determine its {@skill Perception}, {@skill Acrobatics}, and {@skill Stealth} modifiers (see {@quickref Familiars||0|familiars} for more information).

name: Alchemical Savant
entries: You can identify alchemical items quickly. When using the {@skill Crafting} skill to {@action Identify Alchemy} on an alchemical item you hold, you can do so as a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} and {@trait manipulate} traits, instead of spending 10 minutes. If you have the formula for the item you are attempting to identify, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check, and if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

name: Alchemist Dedication
entries: You put your alchemical interest into practice. You become trained in alchemical bombs and {@skill Crafting}; if you were already trained in {@skill Crafting}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in alchemist class DC.
You gain the {@class alchemist|crb|alchemist's} {@classFeature Alchemy|Alchemist|CRB|1||infused reagents} class feature, gaining a number of reagents each day equal to your level.

You also gain the {@feat Alchemical Crafting} feat and four additional formulas for 1st-level alchemical items, as well as the ability to create free items during your daily preparations. Your advanced alchemy level is 1 and doesn't increase on its own.
special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the alchemist archetype.

name: Align Armament
prerequisites: chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity
entries: You bring a weapon into metaphysical concordance with your deity's beliefs. When you select this feat, choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. Your choice must match one of your deity's alignment components. This action has the trait corresponding to the chosen alignment component.

When you use this action, you touch a weapon. For 1 round, that weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage of the chosen type to creatures of the opposed alignment. For example, if you chose good, the weapon would deal an extra {@damage 1d6} good damage to evil creatures. If you Align an Armament again, any previously aligned armament loses its additional damage.
special: You can select this feat a second time, choosing your deity's other alignment component. When you Align an Armament, you can choose either alignment component.

name: Allegro
entries: You can quicken your allies with a fast-paced performance.
You learn the {@spell allegro} composition cantrip.

name: Ancestral Longevity
entries: You have accumulated a vast array of lived knowledge over the years. During your daily preparations, you can reflect upon your life experiences to gain the trained proficiency rank in one skill of your choice. This proficiency lasts until you prepare again. Since this proficiency is temporary, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a skill increase or a permanent character option like a feat.

name: Ancestral Paragon
entries: Whether through instinct, study, or magic, you feel a deeper connection to your ancestry. You gain a {@filter 1st-level ancestry feat|feats||type=ancestry|level=[1]}.

name: Anchoring Aura
requirements: Fiendsbane Oath.
entries: Your aura hampers fiends' teleportation. Your aura attempts to {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting} {@trait teleportation} spells cast by fiends within 15 feet, using the spell level and DC of your devotion spells.

name: Animal Accomplice
entries: You build a rapport with an animal, which becomes magically bonded to you. You gain a {@filter familiar|companionsfamiliars||Type=Familiar}. The type of animal is up to you, but most gnomes choose animals with a burrow Speed.

name: Animal Companion
entries: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you on your adventures and obeys any simple commands you give it to the best of its abilities. See {@quickref Animal Companions||0|Animal Companions} for more information.

name: Animal Companion
entries: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you and obeys simple commands as best as it can. See {@quickref Animal Companions||0|Animal Companions}. When you {@action Hunt Prey}, your animal companion gains the action's benefits and your hunter's edge benefit if you have one.

name: Animal Elocutionist
entries: You hear animal sounds as conversations instead of unintelligent noise, and can respond in turn.
You can speak to all animals, not just animals with a burrow Speed. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to {@action Make an Impression} on animals (which usually uses the {@skill Diplomacy} skill).

name: Animal Rage
entries: You transform into your animal. You gain the effects of the 3rd-level {@spell animal form} spell except you use your own statistics, temporary Hit Points, and unarmed attacks instead of those granted by animal form. You also retain the constant abilities of your gear. If your animal is a frog, your tongue's reach increases to 15 feet. Dismissing the transformation gains the {@trait rage} trait.

name: Animal Skin
entries: Your proficiency in unarmored defense increases to expert.

While you are raging and unarmored, your skin transforms into a thick hide resembling your animal's skin. You gain a +1 status bonus to AC instead of taking a –1 penalty to AC; if you have the {@classFeature greater juggernaut|Barbarian||13} class feature, this status bonus increases to +2. The thickness of your hide gives you a Dexterity modifier cap to your AC of +3.

name: Arcane Breadth
entries: You can cast more arcane spells each day. Increase the spell slots you gain from wizard archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest Wizard spell slots.

name: Arcane Evolution
entries: Your arcane legacy grants you an exceptional aptitude for intellectual and academic pursuits. You become trained in one skill of your choice. Additionally, you keep a book of arcane spells similar to a wizard's spellbook. You add all the spells in your spell repertoire to this book for free, and you can add additional arcane spells to the book by paying the appropriate cost and using your {@skill Arcana} skill, similarly to how a wizard can Learn Spells to add those spells to his spellbook.
During your daily preparations, choose any one spell from your book of arcane spells.
If it isn't in your spell repertoire, add it to your spell repertoire until the next time you prepare. If it's already in your spell repertoire, add it as an additional signature spell for that day.

name: Arcane School Spell
entries: Select one arcane {@classFeature arcane school|wizard||1||school of magic}. You gain the school's initial school spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can {@action Refocus} by studying.

name: Arcane Sense
entries: Your study of magic allows you to instinctively sense its presence. You can cast 1st-level {@spell detect magic} at will as an arcane innate spell. If you're a master in {@skill Arcana}, the spell is heightened to 3rd level; if you're legendary, it is heightened to 4th level.

name: Archwizard's Might
entries: You have mastered the greatest secrets of arcane magic. You gain an additional 10th-level spell slot.

name: Armor Proficiency
entries: You become trained in light armor. If you already were trained in light armor, you gain training in medium armor. If you were trained in both, you become trained in heavy armor.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time, you become trained in the next type of armor above.

name: Arrow Snatching
entries: You pluck missiles from the air and hurl them back at their source. When you successfully deflect an attack with Deflect Arrow, as part of that reaction, you can immediately make a ranged {@action Strike} against the attacker using the projectile you deflected. This is a thrown weapon with the same range increment and effect on a hit as the triggering attack.

name: Assisting Shot
requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon
entries: With a quick shot, you interfere with a foe in combat. Make a {@action Strike} with a ranged weapon. If the strike hits, the next creature other than you to attack the same target before the start of your next turn gains a +1 circumstance bonus on their roll, or a +2 circumstance bonus if your {@action Strike} was a critical hit.

name: Assurance
prerequisites: trained in at least one skill
entries: Even in the worst circumstances, you can perform basic tasks.

Choose a skill you're trained in. You can forgo rolling a skill check for that skill to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus (do not apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers).
special: You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, choose a different skill and gain the benefits for that skill.

name: Attack Of Opportunity
trigger: A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.
entries: You swat a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action.
This {@action Strike} doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike}.

name: Attack Of Opportunity
trigger: A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.
entries: You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This {@action Strike} doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike}.

name: Aura Of Courage
entries: You stand strong in the face of danger and inspire your allies to do the same. Whenever you become {@condition frightened}, reduce the condition value by 1 (to a minimum of 0). At the end of your turn when you would reduce your {@condition frightened} condition value by 1, you also reduce the value by 1 for all allies within 15 feet.

name: Aura Of Faith
entries: You radiate an aura of pure belief that imbues your attacks and those of nearby allies with holy power. Your Strikes deal an extra 1 good damage against evil creatures. Also, each good-aligned ally within 15 feet gains this benefit on their first {@action Strike} that hits an evil creature each round.

name: Aura Of Life
requirements: Shining Oath.
entries: Your aura protects against necromantic effects. You and all allies within 15 feet gain resistance 5 to negative energy and a +1 status bonus to saves against {@trait necromancy} effects.

name: Aura Of Righteousness
entries: Your righteous aura dampens evil's might. You and all allies within 15 feet gain evil resistance 5.

name: Aura Of Vengeance
requirements: exalt, Vengeful Oath.
entries: When you call upon others to take retribution, you also guide their aim. When you use {@action Retributive Strike}, your allies who make Strikes take only a –2 penalty, instead of a –5 penalty.

name: Auspicious Mount
entries: Guided by your ongoing care, your steed has developed incredible intelligence and skill. The mount you gained through the {@feat divine ally} class feature is now a {@quickref specialized animal companion||0|Specialized Animal Companions}. You can select one of the usual specializations or the auspice specialization.

Auspice mounts gain the following benefits: Your companion is marked by your deity's religious symbol as a sacred creature of your deity. Its proficiency rank in {@skill Religion} increases to expert, it can speak the language associated with your deity's servitors (Celestial for champions who follow the tenets of good), and its Intelligence modifier increases by 2 and its Wisdom modifier by 1.

name: Automatic Knowledge
prerequisites: expert in a skill with the {@action Recall Knowledge} action, {@feat Assurance} in that skill
entries: You know basic facts off the top of your head. Choose a skill you're an expert in that has the {@action Recall Knowledge} action and for which you have the Assurance feat. You can use the {@action Recall Knowledge} action with that skill as a free action once per round.
If you do, you must use Assurance on the skill check.
special: You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different skill each time. You can use Automatic Knowledge with any skills you have chosen, but you can still use Automatic Knowledge only once per round.

name: Avatar's Audience
entries: Your extensive service has made you a lesser herald of your deity, which affords you certain privileges. First, any creature you encounter knows instinctively that you speak for your deity. Second, if you conduct the commune ritual to contact your deity, you don't have to pay any cost and you automatically get a critical success. Third, once per day, you can cast {@spell plane shift} as a divine innate spell, but only to travel to the realm of your deity. When you cast it this way, its casting time is 1 minute, your religious symbol is a sufficient tuning fork for this spell, and you appear exactly where you want to be. If you're in your deity's realm due to this spell, you can return to the point you left when you cast it by spending a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} and {@trait divine} traits.

name: Awesome Blow
entries: Your attacks are so powerful, they can flatten your opponents.
When you use Knockback, you can attempt an {@skill Athletics} check against your target's Fortitude DC.

entries.Critical Success: You gain the critical success effect of a {@action Shove}, then the critical success effect of a {@action Trip} against the target.
entries.Success: You gain the success effect of a {@action Shove}, then the success effect of a {@action Trip} against the target.
entries.Failure: You gain the normal effect of Knockback.

name: Barbarian Dedication
entries: You become trained in {@skill Athletics}; if you were already trained in {@skill Athletics}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.
You become trained in barbarian class DC.
You can use the {@action Rage} action.

Choose an {@classFeature instinct|Barbarian||1} as you would if you were a barbarian. You have that instinct for all purposes and become bound by its anathema, but you don't gain any of the other abilities it grants.
special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the barbarian archetype.

name: Barbarian Resiliency
prerequisites: {@feat Barbarian Dedication}, class granting no more Hit Points per level than 10 + your Constitution modifier
entries: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each barbarian archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting barbarian archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.

name: Bard Dedication
entries: You cast spells like a bard and gain the {@action Cast a Spell} activity. You gain a spell repertoire with two common cantrips from the occult spell list, or any other cantrips you learn or discover. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells. Your key spellcasting ability for bard archetype spells is Charisma, and they are occult bard spells. You become trained in {@skill Occultism} and {@skill Performance}; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.
Choose a muse as you would if you were a bard. You have that muse for all purposes, allowing you to take that muse's feats, but you don't gain any of the other abilities it grants.
special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the bard archetype.

name: Bardic Lore
entries: Your studies make you informed on every subject. You are trained in {@skill Lore||Bardic Lore}, a special {@skill Lore} skill that can be used only to {@action Recall Knowledge}, but on any topic. If you have legendary proficiency in {@skill Occultism}, you gain expert proficiency in {@skill Lore||Bardic Lore}, but you can't increase your proficiency rank in {@skill Lore||Bardic Lore} by any other means.

name: Bargain Hunter
entries: You can {@action Earn Income} using {@skill Diplomacy}, spending your days hunting for bargains and reselling at a profit. You can also spend time specifically sniffing out a great bargain on an item; this works as if you were using {@action Earn Income} with {@skill Diplomacy}, except instead of gaining money, you purchase the item at a discount equal to the money you would have gained, gaining the item for free if your earned income equals or exceeds its cost. Finally, if you select Bargain Hunter during character creation at 1st level, you start play with an additional 2 gp.

name: Basic Arcana
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level wizard|feats||classes=wizard|level=[1;2]} feat of your choice.

name: Basic Bard Spellcasting
entries: You gain the {@quickref basic spellcasting benefits|CRB|0|spellcasting archetypes}. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the bard archetype, add a common occult spell or another spell you learned or discovered to your repertoire, of the appropriate spell level.

name: Basic Blood Potency
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level sorcerer|feats||classes=sorcerer|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Bloodline Spell
entries: You gain your {@classFeature bloodline|Sorcerer||1}'s {@filter initial bloodline spell|spells||Level=1|Spell Type=Focus Spell|Classes=Sorcerer}. If you don't already have one, you also gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can {@action Refocus} without any special effort.

name: Basic Cleric Spellcasting
entries: You gain the {@quickref basic spellcasting benefits|CRB|0|spellcasting archetypes}. You can prepare your deity's spells in your spell slots of the appropriate level from the cleric archetype.

name: Basic Concoction
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level alchemist|feats||classes=alchemist|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Devotion
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level champion|feats||classes=champion|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Dogma
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level cleric|feats||classes=cleric|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Druid Spellcasting
entries: You gain the {@quickref basic spellcasting benefits|CRB|0|spellcasting archetypes}.

name: Basic Fury
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level barbarian|feats||classes=Barbarian|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Hunter's Trick
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level ranger|feats||classes=ranger|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Kata
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level monk|feats||classes=monk|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Maneuver
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level fighter|feats||classes=fighter|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Muse's Whispers
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level bard|feats||classes=bard|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Sorcerer Spellcasting
entries: You gain the {@quickref basic spellcasting benefits|CRB|0|spellcasting archetypes}. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the sorcerer archetype, add a spell of the appropriate spell level to your repertoire: a common spell of your bloodline's tradition, one of your bloodline's granted spells, or another spell you have learned or discovered.

name: Basic Trickery
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level rogue|feats||classes=rogue|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Wilding
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level druid|feats||classes=druid|level=[1;2]} feat.

name: Basic Wizard Spellcasting
entries: You gain the {@quickref basic spellcasting benefits|CRB|0|spellcasting archetypes}. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the wizard archetype, add two common spells of that level to your spellbook.

name: Battle Assessment
entries: With careful observation during battle, you identify an enemy's strengths and weaknesses. The GM rolls a secret {@skill Perception} check for you against the {@skill Deception} or {@skill Stealth} DC (whichever is higher) of an enemy of your choice who is not {@condition concealed} from you, {@condition hidden} from you, or {@condition undetected} by you, and who is engaged in combat. The GM might apply a penalty for the distance between you and the enemy. The enemy is then temporarily immune to your Battle Assessment for 1 day.

entries.Critical Success: The GM chooses two of the following pieces of information about the enemy to tell you: which of the enemy's weaknesses is highest, which of the enemy's saving throws has the lowest modifier, one immunity the enemy has, or which of the enemy's resistances is highest. If the event of a tie, the GM should pick one at random.
entries.Success: The GM chooses one piece of information from the above list to tell you about the enemy.
entries.Critical Failure: The GM gives you false information (the GM makes up the information).

name: Battle Cry
entries: When you roll initiative, you can yell a mighty battle cry and {@action Demoralize} an {@condition observed} foe as a free action. If you're legendary in {@skill Intimidation}, you can use a reaction to {@action Demoralize} your foe when you critically succeed at an attack roll.

name: Battle Medicine
requirements: You are holding or wearing {@item healer's tools}.
entries: You can patch up yourself or an adjacent ally, even in combat. Attempt a {@skill Medicine} check with the same DC as for {@action Treat Wounds}, and restore a corresponding amount of Hit Points; this does not remove the {@condition wounded} condition. As with {@action Treat Wounds}, you can attempt checks against higher DCs if you have the minimum proficiency rank. The target is then temporarily immune to your {@feat Battle Medicine} for 1 day.

name: Bespell Weapon
requirements: Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell.
entries: You siphon the residual energy from the last spell you cast into one weapon you're wielding.
Until the end of your turn, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of a type depending on the school of the spell you just cast.

items: {@b Abjuration} force damage
{@bold Conjuration or Transmutation} the same type as the weapon
{@bold Divination, Enchantment, or Illusion} mental damage
{@b Evocation} a type the spell dealt, or force damage if the spell didn't deal damage
{@b Necromancy} negative damage

name: Bespell Weapon
requirements: Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell.
entries: You siphon spell energy into one weapon you're wielding. Until the end of your turn, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of a type depending on the school of the spell you just cast.

items: {@b Abjuration} force damage
{@bold Conjuration or Transmutation} the same type as the weapon
{@bold Divination, Enchantment, or} Illusion mental damage
{@b Evocation} a type the spell dealt, or force damage if the spell didn't deal damage
{@b Necromancy} negative damage

name: Bizarre Magic
entries: You can draw upon strange variations in your spellcasting, whether or not you can cast occult spells. The DCs to Recognize Spells you cast and {@action Identify Magic} you use increase by 5.

name: Blade Of Justice
entries: You call upon divine power and make a weapon or unarmed {@action Strike} against a foe you have witnessed harming an ally or innocent. The {@action Strike} deals two extra weapon damage dice if the target of your {@action Strike} is evil. Whether or not the target is {@trait evil}, you can convert all the physical damage from the attack into good damage, and if you are a paladin, the {@action Strike} applies all effects that normally apply on a {@action Retributive Strike} (such as {@subclassFeature divine smite|Champion||Paladin||9}).

name: Blank Slate
entries: Your deceptions confound even the most powerful mortal divinations. Detection, {@trait revelation}, and {@trait scrying} effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting} level of 10 or higher. For example, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, true seeing wouldn't reveal you, locate or scrying wouldn't find you, and so on.

name: Blind-fight
entries: Your battle instincts make you more aware of {@condition concealed} and {@condition invisible} opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target {@condition concealed} creatures. You're not {@condition flat-footed} to creatures that are {@condition hidden} from you (unless you're flatfooted to them for reasons other than the {@condition hidden} condition), and you need only a successful DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to target a {@condition hidden} creature.
While you're adjacent to an {@condition undetected} creature of your level or lower, it is instead only {@condition hidden} from you.

name: Blind-fight
entries: Your battle instincts make you more aware of {@condition concealed} and {@condition invisible} opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target {@condition concealed} creatures. You're not {@condition flat-footed} to creatures that are {@condition hidden} from you (unless you're {@condition flat-footed} to them for reasons other than the {@condition hidden} condition), and you need only a successful DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to target a {@condition hidden} creature.
While you're adjacent to an {@condition undetected} creature of your level or lower, it is instead only {@condition hidden} from you.

name: Blind-fight
entries: Your battle instincts make you more aware of {@condition concealed} and {@condition invisible} opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target {@condition concealed} creatures. You're not {@condition flat-footed} to creatures that are {@condition hidden} from you (unless you're {@condition flat-footed} to them for reasons other than the {@condition hidden} condition), and you need only a successful DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to target a {@condition hidden} creature.
While you're adjacent to an {@condition undetected} creature of your level or lower, it is instead only {@condition hidden} from you.

name: Bloodline Breadth
entries: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more spells of your bloodline's tradition each day. Increase the number of spells in your repertoire and number of spell slots you gain from sorcerer archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest Sorcerer spell slots.

name: Bloodline Conduit
entries: Your inborn magical nature lets you redirect ambient energies to fuel your spells. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell} of 5th level or lower that has no duration, you don't expend the spell's slot when you cast it.

name: Bloodline Focus
entries: Your focus recovers faster. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you {@action Refocus||Refocused}, you recover 2 Focus Points when you {@action Refocus} instead of 1.

name: Bloodline Perfection
entries: You command the ultimate powers of your bloodline and tradition. You gain an additional 10th-level spell slot.

name: Bloodline Resistance
entries: Your magical blood makes you more resistant to magic. You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against spells and {@trait magical} effects.

name: Bloodline Wellspring
entries: Your blood's power replenishes your focus. If you have spent at least 3 Focus Points since the last time you {@action Refocus||Refocused}, you recover 3 Focus Points when you {@action Refocus} instead of 1.

name: Bond Conservation
requirements: The last action you used was {@action Drain Bonded Item}.
entries: By carefully manipulating the arcane energies stored in your bonded item as you drain it, you can conserve just enough power to cast another, slightly weaker spell. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell} using the energy from {@action Drain Bonded Item}, you gain an extra use of {@action Drain Bonded Item}. You must use this extra use of {@action Drain Bonded Item} before the end of your next turn or you lose it, and you can use this additional use only to cast a spell 2 or more levels lower than the first spell cast with {@action Drain Bonded Item}.

name: Bonded Animal
entries: You forge strong connections with animals. You can spend 7 days of downtime trying to bond with a normal animal (not a companion or other special animal) that is {@condition friendly} or {@condition helpful} to you. After this duration, attempt a DC 20 {@skill Nature} check. If successful, you bond with the animal. The animal is permanently {@condition helpful} to you, unless you do something egregious to break your bond. A {@condition helpful} animal is easier to direct, as described under {@action Command an Animal}.
Bonding with a new animal ends any previous bond you had. You can't have both a bonded animal and an animal companion (though you can have both a bonded animal and a familiar).

name: Bonded Focus
entries: Your connection to your bonded item increases your focus pool.

If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you {@action Refocus||Refocused} and your bonded item is in your possession, you recover 2 Focus Points when you {@action Refocus} instead of 1.

name: Boulder Roll
entries: Your dwarven build allows you to push foes around, just like a mighty boulder tumbles through a subterranean cavern. Take a {@action Step} into the square of a foe that is your size or smaller, and the foe must move into the empty space directly behind it. The foe must move even if doing so places it in harm's way. The foe can attempt a Fortitude saving throw against your {@skill Athletics} DC to block your {@action Step}. If the foe attempts this saving throw, unless it critically succeeds, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your level plus your Strength modifier.
If the foe can't move into an empty space (if it is surrounded by solid objects or other creatures, for example), your Boulder Roll has no effect.

name: Boundless Reprisals
entries: With a sixth sense for the flow of combat, you can quickly react to any situation as required. At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain a reaction you can use only during that turn.

name: Brawling Focus
entries: You know how to make the most of your attacks when fighting hand-to-hand. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of unarmed strikes in the {@group brawling} group and weapons in the {@group brawling} group. If you have Monastic Weaponry, you also gain the critical specialization effects of all monk weapons in which you are trained.

name: Breath Control
entries: You have incredible breath control, which grants you advantages when air is hazardous or sparse. You can hold your breath for 25 times as long as usual before suffocating. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against inhaled threats, such as inhaled poisons, and if you roll a success on such a saving throw, you get a critical success instead.

name: Brutal Beating
entries: The brutality of your critical hits shakes your foes' confidence. Whenever your {@action Strike} is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is {@condition frightened 1}.

name: Brutal Bully
entries: You push your foes around and leave bruises. While raging, when you successfully {@action Disarm}, {@action Grapple}, {@action Shove}, or {@action Trip} a foe, you deal that foe bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier; add this to the damage from a critical success to {@action Trip}.

name: Brutal Critical
entries: Your critical hits are particularly devastating. On a critical hit with a melee {@action Strike}, add one extra damage die. This is in addition to any extra dice you gain if the weapon is {@trait deadly} or {@trait fatal}. The target also takes {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} equal to two damage dice.

name: Brutal Finish
requirements: You are wielding a melee weapon in two hands.
entries: Your final blow can make an impact even if it rebounds off a foe's defenses. Make a {@action Strike} with the required weapon. After the {@action Strike}, your turn ends. The {@action Strike} deals one extra weapon damage die, or two extra weapon damage dice if you're at least 18th level. The {@action Strike} also gains the following failure effect.

entries.Failure: You deal damage equal to one weapon damage die of the required weapon. Increase this to two dice if you're at least 18th level.

name: Brutish Shove
requirements: You are wielding a two-handed melee weapon.
entries: Throwing your weight behind your attack, you hit your opponent hard enough to make it stumble back. Make a {@action Strike} with a two-handed melee weapon. If you hit a target that is your size or smaller, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} until the end of your current turn, and you can automatically {@action Shove} it, with the same benefits as the {@action Shove} action (including the critical success effect, if your {@action Strike} was a critical hit). If you move to follow the target, your movement doesn't trigger reactions.
This {@action Strike} has the following failure effect.
{@b Failure} The target becomes {@condition flat-footed} until the end of your current turn.

name: Burn It!
entries: Fire fascinates you. Your spells and alchemical items that deal fire damage gain a status bonus to damage equal to half the spell's level or one-quarter the item's level (minimum 1). You also gain a +1 status bonus to any {@condition persistent damage ||persistent fire damage} you deal.

name: Burrow Elocutionist
entries: You recognize the chittering of ground creatures as its own peculiar language. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the {@skill Diplomacy} skill with animals that have a burrow Speed, such as badgers, ground squirrels, moles, and prairie dogs. The GM determines which animals count for this ability.

name: Calculated Splash
entries: You have calculated all the angles to maximize a bomb's splash. When you throw an alchemical bomb with the {@trait splash} trait, you can cause the bomb to deal splash damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 0) instead of the normal amount.

name: Call Of The Wild
entries: You call upon the creatures of nature to come to your aid. You can spend 10 minutes in concert with nature to replace one of the spells you've prepared in one of your druid spell slots with a {@spell summon animal} or summon plants and fungi spell of the same level.

name: Camouflage
entries: You alter your appearance to blend in to the wilderness. In natural terrain, you can {@action Sneak} even if you're {@condition observed}.

name: Canny Acumen
entries: Your avoidance or observation is beyond the ken of most in your profession. Choose Fortitude saves, Reflex saves, Will saves, or {@skill Perception}. You become an expert in your choice. At 17th level, you become a master in your choice.

name: Cantrip Expansion
entries: Study broadens your range of simple spells. Add two additional cantrips from your spell list to your repertoire.

name: Cantrip Expansion
entries: You study a wider range of simple spells. You can prepare two additional cantrips each day.

name: Cantrip Expansion
entries: You better understand the basic power of your bloodline. Add two additional cantrips from your spell list to your repertoire.

name: Cantrip Expansion
entries: Dedicated study allows you to prepare a wider range of simple spells. You can prepare two additional cantrips each day.

name: Cast Down
entries: The sheer force of your faith can bring a foe crashing down. If the next action you use is to cast {@spell harm} or heal to damage one creature, the target is knocked {@condition prone} if it takes any damage from the spell. If the target critically fails its save against the spell, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute.

name: Castigating Weapon
entries: The force of your deity's castigation strengthens your body so you can strike down the wicked. After you damage a fiend using a {@spell heal} spell, your weapon or unarmed Strikes deal extra good damage to fiends equal to half the level of the {@spell heal} spell until the end of your next turn. This is cumulative with any good damage the weapon already deals (such as from a holy rune).

name: Cat Fall
entries: Your catlike aerial acrobatics allow you to cushion your falls. Treat falls as 10 feet shorter. If you're an expert in {@skill Acrobatics}, treat falls as 25 feet shorter. If you're a master in {@skill Acrobatics}, treat them as 50 feet shorter. If you're legendary in {@skill Acrobatics}, you always land on your feet and don't take damage, regardless of the distance of the fall.

name: Cave Climber
entries: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.

name: Ceaseless Shadows
entries: You excel at going {@condition unnoticed}, especially among a crowd. You no longer need to have cover or be {@condition concealed} to {@action Hide} or {@action Sneak}. If you would have lesser cover from creatures, you gain cover and can {@action Take Cover}, and if you would have cover from creatures, you gain greater cover.

name: Celestial Form
entries: You take on a celestial countenance, appearing like a type of celestial who serves your deity; for example, as an angel, you would gain a {@feat halo|APG} and feathery wings. You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed. You gain {@ability darkvision} if you don't already have it, and you gain the {@trait celestial} trait and the trait appropriate to the type of servitor you've become (archon, angel, or azata, for example).

name: Celestial Mount
entries: Your steed gains incredible celestial powers granted by your deity. It gains {@ability darkvision}, its maximum Hit Points increase by 40, and it gains weakness 10 to evil damage.

Additionally, it grows wings appropriate to a servitor of your deity (such as metallic wings for an archon), granting it a fly Speed equal to its Speed. It gains the {@trait celestial} trait and the trait appropriate to the type of servitor it has become ({@trait archon}, {@trait angel}, or {@trait azata}, for example).

name: Certain Strike
entries: Even when you don't hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow. Make a melee {@action Strike}. It gains the following failure effect.

entries.Failure: Your attack deals any damage it would have dealt on a hit, excluding all damage dice. (This removes damage dice from weapon runes, spells, and special abilities, in addition to weapon damage dice.)

name: Champion Dedication
entries: Choose a deity and cause as you would if you were a champion. You become trained in light, medium, and heavy armor. You become trained in {@skill Religion} and your deity's associated skill; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in champion class DC.
You are bound by your deity's anathema and must follow the champion's code and alignment requirements for your cause. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of deity or cause.
special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the champion archetype.

name: Champion Resiliency
prerequisites: {@feat Champion Dedication}, class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier
entries: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each champion archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting champion archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.

name: Champion's Reaction
entries: You can use the champion's reaction associated with your cause.

name: Champion's Sacrifice
entries: You can suffer so that others might live. You can cast the champion's sacrifice devotion spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

name: Channel Smite
cost: Expend a {@spell harm} or {@spell heal} spell.
entries: You siphon the destructive energies of positive or negative energy through a melee attack and into your foe. Make a melee {@action Strike} and add the spell's damage to the {@action Strike}'s damage. This is negative damage if you expended a {@spell harm} spell or positive damage if you expended a {@spell heal} spell. The spell is expended with no effect if your {@action Strike} fails or hits a creature that isn't damaged by that energy type (such as if you hit a non-undead creature with a {@spell heal} spell).

name: Channeled Succor
entries: You can remove conditions with divine grace. You can sacrifice one {@spell heal} spell you've prepared in your extra slots from healing font to cast one of the following spells instead: {@spell remove curse}, {@spell remove disease}, {@spell remove paralysis}, or {@spell restoration}. The spell is heightened to the same level as the {@spell heal} spell you sacrificed.

name: Charming Liar
entries: Your charm allows you to win over those you lie to. When you get a critical success using the {@action Lie} action, the target's attitude toward you improves by one step, as though you'd succeeded at using {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression}. This works only once per conversation, and if you critically succeed against multiple targets using the same result, you choose one creature's attitude to improve. You must be lying to impart seemingly important information, inflate your status, or ingratiate yourself, which trivial or irrelevant lies can't achieve.

{@action Impersonate} to pretend to be a noble if you aren't one. If you want to impersonate a specific noble, you still need to use {@skill Deception} to {@action Impersonate} normally, and to {@action Lie} when necessary.

name: City Scavenger
entries: You know that the greatest treasures often look like refuse, and you scoff at those who throw away perfectly good scraps. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to {@action Subsist}, and you can use {@skill Society} or {@skill Survival} when you {@action Subsist} in a settlement.

When you {@action Subsist} in a city, you also gather valuable junk that silly longshanks threw away. You can {@action Earn Income} using {@skill Society} or {@skill Survival} in the same time as you {@action Subsist}, without spending any additional days of downtime. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to this check.
special: If you have the irongut goblin heritage, increase the bonuses to +2.

name: Cleave
trigger: Your melee {@action Strike} kills a creature or knocks it {@condition unconscious}, and another foe is adjacent to that creature.
entries: You swing clear through one foe and into another. Make a melee {@action Strike} against the second foe.

name: Cleric Dedication
entries: You cast spells like a cleric. You gain access to the {@action Cast a Spell} activity. You can prepare two common cantrips each day from the divine spell list in this book or any other cantrips you learn or discover. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for divine spells. Your key spellcasting ability for cleric archetype spells is Wisdom, and they are divine cleric spells. Choose a deity as you would if you were a cleric. You become bound by that deity's anathema. You become trained in {@skill Religion} and your deity's associated skill; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of deity.
special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the cleric archetype.

name: Clever Counterspell
entries: You creatively apply your prepared spells to {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)||Counterspell} a much wider variety of your opponents' magic. Instead of being able to counter a foe's spell with {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)||Counterspell} only if you have that same spell prepared, you can use {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)||Counterspell} as long as you have the spell the foe is casting in your spellbook. When you use {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)||Counterspell} in this way, the prepared spell you expend must share a trait other than its tradition with the triggering spell. At the GM's discretion, you can instead use a spell that has an opposing trait or that otherwise logically would counter the triggering spell (such as using a {@trait cold} or {@trait water} spell to counter {@spell fireball} or using {@spell remove fear} to counter a {@spell fear} spell)
Regardless of what spell you expend, you take a –2 penalty to your counteract check, though the GM can waive this penalty if the expended spell is especially appropriate.

name: Clever Improviser
entries: You've learned how to handle situations when you're out of your depth. You gain the {@feat Untrained Improvisation} general feat. In addition, you can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained, even if you are untrained.

name: Cloud Jump
entries: You unparalleled athletic skill allows you to jump impossible distances. Triple the distance you {@action Long Jump} (so you could jump 60 feet on a successful DC 20 check). When you {@action High Jump}, use the calculation for a {@action Long Jump} but don't triple the distance.

You can jump a distance greater than your Speed by spending additional actions when you {@action Long Jump} or {@action High Jump}. {@footnote For each additional action spent, add your Speed to the limit on how far you can Leap.|As an example, supposing you had a Speed of 40 feet and 25 on your {@skill Athletics} check, Cloud Jump triples the 25 feet to 75 feet, but the limit of 40 feet still applies so you would jump 40 feet. If you spent another action, the limit based on your Speed would raise from 40 feet to 80 feet, so you would jump 75 feet.|{@link Pathfinder Core Rulebook Errata|https://paizo.com/pathfinder/faq}}

name: Cloud Step
entries: Using fantastic acrobatic skill, you can walk for brief stretches across insubstantial surfaces. When you {@action Stride}, you can move across water, air, and solid surfaces that can hold only limited weight as if they were normal ground. If you {@action Stride} over a trap with a weight-sensitive pressure plate, you don't trigger it. At the end of your turn, you sink, fall, break fragile surfaces, or trigger traps as normal for your current location.

name: Cognitive Loophole
trigger: Your turn ends.
requirements: You are currently affected by a {@trait mental} effect that you gained by failing, but not critically failing, a saving throw.
entries: You can find a loophole in a {@trait mental} effect to temporarily overcome it. Until the end of your next turn, you ignore a single {@trait mental} effect that meets the requirement. You can suppress a particular effect using Cognitive Loophole only once.
special: You can use this reaction even if the {@trait mental} effect is preventing you from using reactions.

name: Collateral Thrash
entries: When you Thrash a {@condition grabbed} foe, you smack that foe into another nearby. Another foe adjacent to the {@condition grabbed} foe also takes your Thrash damage, with a basic Reflex save against your class DC.

name: Combat Climber
entries: Your techniques allow you to fight as you climb. You're not {@condition flat-footed} while Climbing and can {@action Climb} with a hand occupied.
You must still use another hand and both legs to {@action Climb}.

name: Combat Grab
requirements: You have one hand free, and your target is within reach of that hand.
entries: You swipe at your opponent and grab at them. Make a melee {@action Strike} while keeping one hand free. If the {@action Strike} hits, you grab the target using your free hand. The creature remains {@condition grabbed} until the end of your next turn or until it {@action Escape||Escapes}, whichever comes first.

name: Combat Reflexes
entries: You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings. At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to make an {@action Attack of Opportunity}.

name: Combine Elixirs
trigger: You use {@action Quick Alchemy} to craft an alchemical item that has the {@trait elixir} trait and is at least 2 levels lower than your advanced alchemy level.
entries: You've discovered how to mix two elixirs into a single hybrid concoction. You can spend 2 additional batches of infused reagents to add a second elixir to the one you're crafting.

The second elixir must also be at least 2 levels lower than your advanced alchemy level, and the combination elixir is an alchemical item two levels higher than the higher of the two elixirs' levels. When this combination elixir is consumed, both the constituent elixirs take effect. For example, you can combine two elixirs of life to create a combined elixir that heals twice the normal amount, or you can combine a lesser {@ability darkvision} elixir with a lesser eagle-eye elixir to both gain {@ability darkvision} and find secret doors.

name: Come And Get Me
entries: You open yourself to attacks so you can respond in turn. Until your rage ends, you are {@condition flat-footed}, and damage rolls against you gain a +2 circumstance bonus. If a creature hits you, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} to you until the end of your next turn. If you hit it before the end of your next turn, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier, or double that on a critical hit.
These temporary Hit Points last until the end of your rage.

name: Command Undead
entries: You grasp the animating force within an undead creature and bend it to your will. If the next action you use is to cast {@spell harm} targeting one undead creature, you transform the effects of that {@spell harm} spell. Instead of harm's normal effects, the target becomes {@condition controlled} by you if its level is equal to or lower than your level – 3. It can attempt a Will saving throw to resist being {@condition controlled} by you. If the target is already under someone else's command, the controlling creature also rolls a saving throw, and the undead uses the better result.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The target is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The undead creature becomes a minion under your control. The spell gains a duration of 1 minute, but it is dismissed if you or an ally attacks the minion undead.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the duration is 1 hour.

name: Communal Healing
entries: You're a conduit for positive energy, and as you channel it through you, it heals some of your minor injuries. When you cast the {@spell heal} spell to heal a single creature other than yourself, you regain Hit Points equal to the spell level of the {@spell heal} spell.

name: Companion's Cry
entries: You can urge your companion to do its utmost. You can spend 2 actions to {@action Command an Animal} instead of 1 when commanding your animal companion. If you do, your animal companion uses an additional action.

name: Conceal Spell
entries: Hiding your gestures and incantations within other speech and movement, you attempt to conceal the fact that you are {@action Cast a Spell||Casting a Spell}. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell}, attempt a {@skill Stealth} check against one or more observers' {@skill Perception} DCs; if the spell has verbal components, you must also attempt a {@skill Deception} check against the observers' {@skill Perception} DC. If you succeed at your check (or checks) against an observer's DC, that observer doesn't notice you're casting a spell, even though material, somatic, and verbal components are usually noticeable and spells normally have sensory manifestations that would make spellcasting obvious to those nearby.
This ability hides only the spell's spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish into thin air.

name: Confabulator
entries: Even when caught in falsehoods, you pile lie upon lie. Reduce the circumstance bonus a target gains for your previous attempts to {@action Create a Diversion} or {@action Lie} to it from +4 to +2. If you're a master in {@skill Deception}, reduce the bonus to +1, and if you're legendary, your targets don't get these bonuses at all.

name: Connections
entries: You have social connections you can leverage to trade favors or meet important people. When you're in an area with connections (typically a settlement where you've spent downtime building connections, or possibly another area in the same nation), you can attempt a {@skill Society} check to arrange a meeting with an important political figure or ask for a favor in exchange for a later favor of your contact's choice. The GM decides the DC based on the difficulty of the favor and the figure's prominence.

name: Contagious Rage
entries: You can drive your allies into a frenzy, granting them incredible benefits. You can ignore the requirements on {@feat Share Rage}, using it multiple times in a {@action Rage}. Allies affected by {@feat Share Rage} who accept your anathema for the duration of the {@action Rage} gain your instinct ability and the specialization ability it gains from weapon specialization, but not greater weapon specialization.

name: Continual Recovery
entries: You zealously monitor a patient's progress to administer treatment faster. When you {@action Treat Wounds}, your patient becomes immune for only 10 minutes instead of 1 hour. This applies only to your {@action Treat Wounds} activities, not any other the patient receives.

name: Cooperative Nature
entries: The short human life span lends perspective and has taught you from a young age to set aside differences and work with others to achieve greatness. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus on checks to {@action Aid}.

name: Cooperative Soul
entries: You have developed a soul-deep bond with your comrades and maintain an even greater degree of cooperation with them. If you are at least an expert in the skill you are Aiding, you get a success on any outcome rolled to {@action Aid} other than a critical success.

name: Counter Perform
entries: You gain the {@spell counter performance} {@classFeature composition spells|Bard||1||composition spell}.
If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can {@action Refocus} by engaging your muse.

name: Counterspell
trigger: A creature casts a spell that you have in your repertoire.
requirements: You have an unexpended spell slot you could use to cast the triggering spell.
entries: When a foe {@action Cast a Spell|CRB|Casts a Spell} you know and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to disrupt it.

You expend one of your spell slots to counter the triggering creature's casting of a spell that you have in your repertoire. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting} the triggering spell.
special: This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast ({@trait arcane}, {@trait divine}, {@trait natural}, or {@trait occult}).

name: Counterspell
trigger: A creature {@action Cast a Spell||Casts a Spell} that you have prepared.
entries: When a foe {@action Cast a Spell|CRB|Casts a Spell} and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to disrupt it.

You expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting} the triggering spell.

name: Courtly Graces
entries: You were raised among the nobility or have learned proper etiquette and bearing, allowing you to present yourself as a noble and play games of influence and politics. You can use {@skill Society} to {@action Make an Impression} on a noble, as well as with {@action Impersonate} to pretend to be a noble if you aren't one. If you want to impersonate a specific noble, you still need to use {@skill Deception} to {@action Impersonate} normally, and to {@action Lie} when necessary.

name: Craft Anything
entries: You can find ways to craft just about anything, despite restrictions. As long as you have the appropriate {@skill Crafting} skill feat (such as {@feat Magical Crafting} for magic items) and meet the item's level and proficiency requirement, you ignore just about any other requirement, such as being of a specific ancestry or providing spells. The only exceptions are requirements that add to the item's cost, including castings of spells that themselves have a cost, and requirements of special items such as the philosopher's stone that have exclusive means of access and {@skill Crafting}. The GM decides whether you can ignore a requirement.

name: Craft Philosopher's Stone
entries: Your research has paid off, culminating in the legendary philosopher's stone. You learn the formula for the {@item philosopher's stone} and can add it to your formula book.

name: Crane Flutter
trigger: You are targeted with a melee attack by an attacker you can see.
requirements: You are in Crane Stance.
entries: You interpose your arm between yourself and your opponent.

Your circumstance bonus to AC from Crane Stance increases to +3 against the triggering attack. If the attack misses you, you can immediately make a crane wing {@action Strike} against the attacker at a –2 penalty, even if the attacker isn't within your reach.

name: Crane Stance
requirements: You are unarmored.
entries: You enter the stance of a crane, holding your arms in an imitation of a crane's wings and using flowing, defensive motions. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC, but the only Strikes you can make are crane wing attacks. These deal {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage; are in the {@group brawling} group; and have the {@trait agile}, {@trait finesse}, {@trait nonlethal}, and {@trait unarmed} traits.
While in Crane Stance, reduce the DC for {@action High Jump} and {@action Long Jump} by 5, and when you {@action Leap}, you can move an additional 5 feet horizontally or 2 feet vertically.

name: Cremate Undead
entries: Your positive energy sets undead alight. When you use a {@spell heal} spell to damage undead, each undead that takes damage also takes {@condition persistent damage ||persistent fire damage} equal to the spell's level.

name: Critical Debilitation
entries: Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks. Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll against an enemy and use {@action Debilitating Strike}, add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from.

items: {@bold Debilitation} The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following effects.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected.
entries.Success: The target is {@condition slowed 1} until the end of your next turn.
entries.Failure: The target is {@condition slowed 2} until the end of your next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: The target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn.

name: Crossblooded Evolution
entries: Odd interactions in your bloodline provide you with unexpected spells. You can have one spell in your spell repertoire from a tradition other than the one that matches your bloodline. You cast that spell as a spell from your bloodline's tradition. You can swap which spell you add and from which tradition as you could any other sorcerer spell, but you can't have more than one spell from another tradition in your spell repertoire at the same time using this feat.

name: Crossbow Ace
entries: You have a deep understanding of the crossbow. When you're wielding a crossbow and use {@action Hunt Prey} or use {@action Interact} to reload your crossbow, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the damage roll on your next {@action Strike} with that crossbow. If the crossbow is a simple crossbow, also increase the damage die size for that attack by one step. You must make the attack before the end of your next turn or these benefits are lost.

name: Crushing Grab
entries: Like a powerful constrictor, you crush targets in your unyielding grasp. When you successfully {@action Grapple} a creature, you can deal bludgeoning damage to that creature equal to your Strength modifier. You can make this attack nonlethal with no penalty.

name: Cultural Adaptability
entries: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the {@feat Adopted Ancestry} general feat, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the ancestry you chose for the Adopted Ancestry feat.

name: Dancing Leaf
entries: You are as light as a leaf whirling in the breeze. When you {@action Leap} or succeed at a {@action High Jump} or {@action Long Jump}, increase the distance you jump by 5 feet. When calculating the damage you take from falling, don't count any distance fallen while you are adjacent to a wall.

name: Dangerous Sorcery
entries: Your legacy grants you great destructive power. When you {@action Cast a Spell} from your spell slots, if the spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, you gain a status bonus to that spell's damage equal to the spell's level.

name: Deadly Aim
entries: You aim for your prey's weak spots, making your shot more challenging but dealing more damage if you hit. Make a ranged {@action Strike} against your hunted prey at a –2 penalty. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to damage on that {@action Strike}. This bonus increases to +6 at 11th level and +8 at 15th level.

name: Deadly Simplicity
prerequisites: deity with a simple or unarmed attack favored weapon, trained with your deity's favored weapon
entries: Your deity's weapon is especially powerful in your hands.
When you are wielding your deity's favored weapon, increase the damage die size of that weapon by one step.
If your deity's favored weapon is an unarmed attack (such as a fist, if you worship Irori) and its damage die is smaller than d6, instead increase its damage die size to d6.

name: Debilitating Bomb
trigger: You use {@action Quick Alchemy} to craft an alchemical bomb that is at least 2 levels lower than your advanced alchemy level.
entries: Your bombs impose additional effects on your enemies.

You mix a substance into the bomb that causes one of the following: {@condition dazzled}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition flat-footed}, or a –5-foot status penalty to Speeds. If the attack with that bomb hits, the target must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw or suffer that effect until the start of your next turn. Use your class DC for this saving throw (even if someone else throws the bomb).

name: Debilitating Shot
entries: Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot. Make a ranged weapon {@action Strike}. If it hits and deals damage, the target is {@condition slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

name: Deep Lore
entries: Your repertoire is vast, containing far more spells than usual.
Add one spell to your repertoire of each level you can cast.

name: Defensive Recovery
entries: Your faith provides temporary protection in addition to healing.
If the next action you use is to cast {@spell harm} or heal on a single target and the target regains Hit Points from the spell, it also gains a +2 status bonus to AC and saving throws for 1 round.

name: Defensive Roll
trigger: A physical attack would reduce you to 0 Hit Points.
entries: Dropping into a roll to disperse the force of the blow, you can partially evade a lethal attack and stay conscious. You take half damage from the triggering attack.

name: Deflect Arrow
trigger: You are the target of a physical ranged attack.
requirements: You're aware of the attack, are not {@condition flat-footed} against it, and have a hand free.
entries: You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, you have deflected it. You cannot use this feat to deflect unusually massive ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

name: Deity's Domain
entries: You embody an aspect of your deity. Choose one of your {@pf2etools deity|deities.html}'s domains. You gain the domain's initial domain spell as a devotion spell.

name: Deity's Protection
entries: When you call upon your deity's power to fulfill the promise of their domain, you gain divine protection. After you cast a domain spell, you gain resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn. The amount of resistance is equal to the level of the domain spell you cast.

name: Delay Trap
trigger: A trap within your reach is triggered.
entries: You can jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects. Attempt a {@skill Thievery} check to {@action Disable a Device} on the trap; the DC to do so is increased by 5, and the effects are as follows.

name: Desperate Finisher
trigger: You complete the last action on your turn, and your turn has not ended yet.
requirements: You meet the requirements to use an action with the {@trait press} trait.
entries: You throw everything into one last press. Use a single action that you know with the {@trait press} trait as part of Desperate Finisher. You forgo the ability to use reactions until the start of your next turn.

name: Determination
entries: Your training allows you to shrug off your foes' spells and conditions when the need is dire. Choose a single nonpermanent spell or condition that is affecting you. If you chose a condition, its effect on you ends. If you chose a spell, attempt to {@quickref counteract|CRB|3|counteracting} the spell (your counteract level is equal to half your level, rounded up, and you attempt a Will save as your counteract check)

This doesn't remove any Hit Point damage normally dealt by the spell or condition, and it doesn't prevent the spell or debilitating effect from affecting other allies or the environment around you. It can't remove an ongoing affliction or prevent such an affliction from inflicting conditions on you later. It can't remove conditions from the situation (such as {@condition prone} or {@condition flanked}). If the effect comes from a creature, hazard, or item of 20th level or higher, Determination can't remove its effect on you.

name: Devoted Focus
entries: Your devotion is strong enough to increase your focus to incredible heights. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you {@action Refocus||Refocused}, you recover 2 Focus Points when you {@action Refocus} instead of 1.

name: Diamond Fists
entries: Your body hardens as you combine your attacks, making your finishing blows more damaging. Your unarmed attacks gain the {@trait forceful} trait. Any that already had this trait instead increase their weapon damage dice by one step.

name: Diamond Soul
entries: You have fortified your body and mind against eldritch effects.
You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magic.

name: Diehard
entries: It takes more to kill you than most. You die from the {@condition dying} condition at {@condition dying 5}, rather than {@condition dying 4}.

name: Directed Channel
entries: You can shape the energy you channel in a single direction, reaching farther and in a more directed fashion. When you cast a version of harm or heal that has an area, you can make its area a 60-foot cone instead of a 30-foot emanation.

name: Directional Bombs
